last_episode_to_air.name: Raise the Roof
last_episode_to_air.overview: A home construction business that's trying to revolutionize the way houses are built is struggling to keep up with demand for their innovative homes. With options to grow in both the residential and commercial market, the owners are also facing a bit of an identity crisis. Marcus must show them the importance of laying a firm foundation first, if they're going to cash in on their potential.

name: The Profit
overview: When Marcus Lemonis isn’t running his multi-billion dollar company, Camping World, he goes on the hunt for struggling businesses that are desperate for cash and ripe for a deal. In the past 10 years, he’s successfully turned around over 100 companies. Now he’s bringing those skills to CNBC and doing something no one has ever done on TV before … he’s putting millions of dollars of his own money on the line. In each episode, Lemonis makes an offer that’s impossible to refuse; his cash for a piece of the business and a percentage of the profits. And once inside these companies, he’ll do almost anything to save the business and make himself a profit; even if it means firing the president, promoting the secretary or doing the work himself.

episodes.name: Car Cash
episodes.overview: Marcus helps two feuding brothers who buy used cars for cash.

episodes.name: Maarse Florist
episodes.overview: Maarse Florists was once thriving but lost its way after the founder's death.

episodes.name: Planet Popcorn
episodes.overview: Despite generating millions in sales, Planet Popcorn still can’t show a profit.

episodes.name: Eco-Me
episodes.overview: Eco-Me's worthy products are undermined by bad business practices and debt.

episodes.name: LA Dogworks
episodes.overview: LA Dogworks is a state-of-the-art dog care facility with a volatile leadership.

episodes.name: Mr. Green Tea
episodes.overview: Marcus Lemonis attempts to help Mr. Green Tea, a family-run ice cream company.

episodes.name: Athans Motors
episodes.overview: Pete Athans sank his life savings into building a high-end used car dealership.

episodes.name: A. Stein Meat Products
episodes.overview: Marcus visits A. Stein Meat Products, a second-generation business in Brooklyn.

episodes.name: Michael Sena's Pro-Fit
episodes.overview: Michael and Tina Sena help clients shed weight but can't make a healthy profit.

episodes.name: WorldWide Trailer Sales, Inc.
episodes.overview: A trailer business in Tampa, Fla. specializing in food concessions is being driven into the ground by two owners in a toxic partnership.

episodes.name: Skullduggery
episodes.overview: Two brothers can't turn a profit on their toy, craft kit and fossil replica manufacturer company.

episodes.name: Sweet Pete's
episodes.overview: Candy maker Sweet Pete's has excellent products, but the business is failing.

episodes.name: Amazing Grapes
episodes.overview: Despite the owners' passion for wine, Amazing Grapes has never been profitable.

episodes.name: Key Lime
episodes.overview: Key West Key Lime Pie Company wins awards and makes millions--but no profit.

episodes.name: Courage.b
episodes.overview: A family-run clothing retailer is given some help.

episodes.name: Artistic Stitch
episodes.overview: A company in Queens is on the verge of shutting their doors forever.

episodes.name: Swanson's Fish Market
episodes.overview: A second-generation business that had burnt to the ground a few years ago.

episodes.name: West End Coffee Company
episodes.overview: Marcus tries to help resolve bitterness between the co-owners of a Greenville, S.C. coffee company.

episodes.name: Schuler's Bar-B-Que
episodes.overview: Business is good at a South Carolina barbecue restaurant, but there is issues keeping up with the demands of hungry customers who are lined up outside.

episodes.name: SJC Drums
episodes.overview: This episode doesn't have a summary yet.

episodes.name: After the Deal
episodes.overview: Marcus returns to Coopersburg Sports, Key Lime Pie Co., Artistic Stitch and Unique Salon & Spa to reveal which partnerships have flourished.

episodes.name: Tonnie's Minis
episodes.overview: Marcus helps the owner of a New York cupcake shop before he loses his business and his marriage.

episodes.name: Standard Burger
episodes.overview: Marcus works with four quarreling owners of a Staten Island burger joint that is bleeding money and pointing fingers.

episodes.name: FuelFood
episodes.overview: Marcus tries to rein in a hot-tempered CEO of a Florida health food delivery service that has developed a sick corporate culture.

episodes.name: Grafton Furniture
episodes.overview: A father's resistance to change is ruining his family furniture business in Miami and wrecking his relationship with his son.

episodes.name: Farrell's Ice Cream Parlour Restaurants
episodes.overview: The fourth season begins with the revival of a well-known restaurant chain that didn't turn out like two business partners planned.

episodes.name: The Soup Market
episodes.overview: A Milwaukee-based chain of soup restaurants needs professional help after its co-owner's sudden passing.

episodes.name: Flex Watches
episodes.overview: A charity-centric watch business suffers from a rushed process, unfocused branding and emotional baggage.

episodes.name: Honest Foods
episodes.overview: A Chicago catering company needs help after suffering a steep drop in sales and an owner who vents his frustration on the employees.

episodes.name: Murchison-Hume
episodes.overview: The owner of a cleaning product line is putting her business at risk with aristocratic marketing, high prices, and an unwillingness to face reality.

episodes.name: Pacific Hospitality
episodes.overview: A Los Angeles furniture company struggles with old inventory and quality control.

episodes.name: Tea2Go
episodes.overview: A father and son with a broken relationship are leading their tea shop franchise into dangerous territory. If Marcus can't get them to separate their business and personal lives, tea time will be over... for good.

episodes.name: Bowery Kitchen Supplies
episodes.overview: A beloved kitchen supply store in Manhattan faces extinction after its owners' divorce. If Marcus can't figure out a way to get them working together, the deal may go up in smoke.

episodes.name: Los Gemelos
episodes.overview: A Mexican-American's tortilla business is being decimated by big competitors. Marcus will team up with George Lopez and the owner to develop products and make this American dream a reality.

episodes.name: Susana Monaco
episodes.overview: Marcus helps a Manhattan-based fashion designer who is failing because she lets her family and co-workers overpower her.

episodes.name: Swim by Chuck Handy
episodes.overview: A family-run swimwear company struggles to connect with consumers due to poor leadership, outdated designs, and misguided processes.

episodes.name: Windward Boardshop
episodes.overview: A Chicago snowboard shop goes downhill after its owners try to expand too quickly and stop communicating with one another.

episodes.name: Ashtae Products
episodes.overview: Marcus helps a family-owned hair care company that reached a breaking point because of the father's costly side projects.

episodes.name: Overtone Acoustics
episodes.overview: Marcus helps a sound-proofing company, started by two best friends, which has so little cash they must rely on unpaid volunteers.

episodes.name: Bodhi Leaf Coffee Traders
episodes.overview: Marcus helps a California entrepreneur who went all-in on a coffee business with no prior experience and got in over his head.

episodes.name: Hip Pops
episodes.overview: Marcus helps a gelato popsicle company whose owner jumped the gun by starting a franchise business and now suffers from a waning work ethic.

episodes.name: Zoe's Chocolate Co.
episodes.overview: A family-owned chocolate shop was started by three siblings in support of their chocolatier father; despite circumstances becoming desperate, the family is resistant to change.

episodes.name: Top 10 Rules for Success
episodes.overview: Marcus Lemonis shares his top 10 most important rules for success while sharing key moments of past episodes.

episodes.name: Marijuana Millions
episodes.overview: Marcus Lemonis travels throughout California, where a new law will soon allow any adult to buy cannabis legally, and profiles several pot entrepreneurs, from small-scale startups to multi-million-dollar ventures.

episodes.name: Biggest Wins and Most Heartbreaking Losses
episodes.overview: Marcus Lemonis looks back at which deals paid off big time and which cost him millions.

episodes.name: Tumbleweed Tiny Homes
episodes.overview: Marcus helps a Colorado manufacturer of tiny homes that faces massive issues, including an owner's lack of leadership, over a million dollars of debt, and low morale.

episodes.name: Detroit Denim
episodes.overview: At a Detroit-based denim business, the three owners all have their own pet interests and goals; one owner stamps out any idea that he didn't come up with; another obsesses over the smallest of details; the third cares only about his own payout.

episodes.name: Monica Potter Home
episodes.overview: Marcus helps Monica Potter's home goods store in rural Ohio; Monica has trouble relinquishing control to employees and her sister.

episodes.name: Mr. Cory's Cookies
episodes.overview: Marcus helps a cookie company owned by a 13-year-old entrepreneur and his mother that faces serious growing pains; Cory's mother struggles to trust anyone and resists change, leading to missed opportunities.

episodes.name: Rayjus
episodes.overview: Tonight on The Profit, Marcus Lemonis is in Morris, Illinois hoping to make a deal with Rayjus. Rayjus is a sports apparel company that specializes in fishing apparel. The name Rayjus is a combination of the first names of owners Ray Odom and Justin Romines. Rayjus has poor employee morale and unfocused owners, including one with a troubling side gig as a radio DJ. Rayjus also owes the IRS thousands in back taxes.

episodes.name: JD Custom Designs
episodes.overview: Marcus Lemonis is in Orange County, California hoping to make a deal with JD Custom Designs. JD Custom Designs is a company that specializes in retail displays. The owner Jeff can't let go of control, which slows the process, limits creativity and negatively impacts the company.

episodes.name: Faded Royalty
episodes.overview: Marcus helps a disorganized New York City fashion designer with unpaid loans and an understaffed store.

episodes.name: Southern Culture
episodes.overview: The owner of a packaged Southern food business bites off more than she can chew, bringing colossal debts that clog her cash flow.

episodes.name: Fighting for Farrell's
episodes.overview: Marcus returns to Farrell's, a business he helped revive in 2017, to find partners and management fighting each other.

episodes.name: Tankfarm & Co.
episodes.overview: A men's apparel business on the California coast is about to unravel completely for co-owners and brothers Mike and John, who found early success selling to big stores, but profitability never followed when they opened up two locations of their own.

episodes.name: The Casery
episodes.overview: A Los Angeles startup is creating buzz with its fashion-forward cell-phone cases; behind its breathtaking sales, the cracks are starting to show; its CEO does whatever he pleases, leaving his partners demoralized and the business unable to grow.

episodes.name: Ellison Eyewear
episodes.overview: A Chicago startup impresses with their high-end sunglasses, but behind the flashy shades, the company struggles to turn a profit; its CEO has trouble moving beyond a personal tragedy, affecting every aspect of the business from marketing to hiring.

episodes.name: Simply Slices
episodes.overview: At a small family-run pizza chain, the proud patriarch is squeezing the life out of the business; he has long dreamed of taking his drive-through pizza concept nationwide, but he's so resistant to change that he alienates potential franchisees.

episodes.name: Hangout Lighting
episodes.overview: A Chicago-based lighting company sparks innovation with unique designs and customizable options, but the owner's lack of leadership causes sales to fizzle; if Marcus can't convince her to value her team, it may be lights out for this startup.

episodes.name: Montiel
episodes.overview: A women’s athleisure company found initial success building a following online, but the owner’s conservative aesthetic is starting to lose popularity, and she refuses to take any risks, despite suffering sales.

episodes.name: Baby Bump
episodes.overview: A husband-and-wife team work tirelessly to keep their maternity and children’s retail stores open, but after 10 years in business, they aren’t certain of their roles or their numbers, and their merchandise lacks universal appeal. Moreover, a recent health crisis put even more stress on the business and their marriage.

episodes.name: NYC Bagel Deli
episodes.overview: A master bagel maker builds a big following in Chicago, but even as he dreams of expanding beyond the Windy City his business is growing stale; if Marcus can't push him to rise to the occasion, this would-be mogul won't be going anywhere.

episodes.name: Queork
episodes.overview: The owner of a chain of cork-based retail stores is in deep debt to her romantic partner because of haphazard business practices. She resists advice from her employees, and Marcus struggles to help her develop new products and upgrade the brand.

episodes.name: Santa's Toys
episodes.overview: Marcus travels to Santa Claus, Ind., to save Santa's Toys; hardworking owners Mark and Heidi's business practices have landed their business on the naughty list, and they must follow Marcus' protocol to save their business.

episodes.name: Ben’s Garden
episodes.overview: Marcus Lemonis invests in struggling businesses in efforts to save them.

episodes.name: After the Casery
episodes.overview: Two former employees from The Casery want to start their own cell phone case brand; Marcus tries to help Charlotte overcome her confidence issues to become a CEO, so she and Skyler can build a new company from the ground up.

episodes.name: Jackie's Cookie Connection
episodes.overview: A cookie business grows too quickly from a tiny shop to a full-production wholesale company, and it is now at the mercy of angry lenders; Marcus tries to teach owner Rachel how to stay in business despite heavy financial consequences.

episodes.name: Lyle's BBQ
episodes.overview: Greg and Jennifer Lyles want to keep their Kentucky BBQ restaurant small and local, but their son, Chandler, has dreams of going national; as the threat of bankruptcy looms, Marcus strives to put this family on the same road to success.

episodes.name: Snowdays
episodes.overview: The owner of an Asian-inspired shaved-cream shop expands his business before perfecting his concept; now, his company is on the verge of bankruptcy; Marcus tries to push him to change his concept and let go of the manufacturing process.

episodes.name: Feat Socks NYC
episodes.overview: Two brash social media influencers build a million dollar sock company but suffer major losses bringing the company to a standstill; Marcus may get cold feet if arrogance prevents the business owners from meeting their goals.

episodes.name: Smithfly Designs
episodes.overview: The owner of a fly-fishing boat and apparel company designs a unique floating tent, but his defensive nature prevents him from taking feedback to improve his brand; Marcus encourages the owner to open up to new ideas.

episodes.name: Dante's
episodes.overview: At a struggling Italian restaurant in New Jersey, Marcus Lemonis tries to teach owner Dante management skills.

episodes.name: CocoTaps
episodes.overview: "Coco Vinny” wants to spread the “coco love" to the rest of the country by selling coconut beverages.

episodes.name: Skinny Latina
episodes.overview: Local Miami celebrity Ana Quincoces has personality to spare, but her burgeoning sauce and marinade business has failed to take off.

episodes.name: Polar Bear Coolers
episodes.overview: At Polar Bear Coolers sales have been plummeting the last few years due to a broken inventory process and an owner more concerned with "rocking out" than appreciating his employees. If Marcus can't help this uninhibited owner improve his communication and streamline his process this company will meltdown.

episodes.name: Macaron Queen
episodes.overview: A mother and daughter team dealing with health problems and family resentments needs Marcus to help them face their issues and raise their macaron business to the next level.

episodes.name: Las Vegas Mini Gran Prix
episodes.overview: Marcus Lemonis will try to help the owner of a mini race car track get out of the past and teach his over-reactive ex-racer son to lead his employees rather than just yelling at them.

episodes.name: Rise of an American Floodtown
episodes.overview: Marcus Lemonis goes to a Mississippi town, where he learns about the economic effects of a natural disaster.

episodes.name: B Sweet
episodes.overview: Marcus must help an unbelievably sweet and successful entrepreneur of a local dessert shop in Los Angeles rein in her ideas before her many ventures cause chaos to her delectable empire

episodes.name: Cover Your Hide
episodes.overview: One woman is on a mission to create her own line of handbags that has resulted in quality, but a bland and overpriced product. Marcus must help her become a more creative and better businessperson.

episodes.name: Campervans - A Crash Course In Van Life
episodes.overview: A Los Angeles-based van conversion company is excited to bring even more people to their outdoor lifestyle.

episodes.name: Mo Honey, Mo Problems
episodes.overview: Marcus faces his biggest challenge to date when he visits a family business in Utah with a buzzworthy product that is drowning in debt; with his help, the family needs to become a hive of activity, or risk losing its lifetime investments.

episodes.name: Any Way You Slice It
episodes.overview: A Santa Monica staple serving up creative slices has Marcus' head spinning; Marcus must get the owner to fall back in love with his business and resolve his relationship with a not-so-silent partner or he risks losing his 20-year pizza legacy.

episodes.name: Checks and Balances
episodes.overview: A brother and sister are desperate to keep their furniture business open and their father's legacy alive; struggling to balance their lives and roles in the company, confusion, and money problems mean Marcus has his work cut out for him.

episodes.name: Sweet Dreams Are Made of This
episodes.overview: A Salt Lake City sweet potato pie business with humble beginnings has gained a strong following in the local community. But Marcus will have to bring the owner’s pie-in-the-sky goals back down to earth before the business can go nationwide.

episodes.name: Who's the Boss
episodes.overview: A small-town spirits company needs Marcus' help to expand beyond their local community. Family-owned and operated, this business must come to terms with their past and agree on their future if they truly want a shot at the big time.

episodes.name: A New Leash on Life
episodes.overview: A business owner with a love of animals gives Marcus a new challenge. While her product is great, she lacks some of the business skills to bring it to the masses. Marcus will need to help her find the same passion for profits she has for her pets, if this business' true potential is to be unleashed.

episodes.name: Claws and Effect
episodes.overview: A Brooklyn crab restaurant started by two best friends has Marcus excited about the possibilities. At first glance, it has all the makings of the next great chain, but when Marcus digs deeper, he discovers the owners' inner soft spots and insecurities.

episodes.name: Raise the Roof
episodes.overview: A home construction business that's trying to revolutionize the way houses are built is struggling to keep up with demand for their innovative homes. With options to grow in both the residential and commercial market, the owners are also facing a bit of an identity crisis. Marcus must show them the importance of laying a firm foundation first, if they're going to cash in on their potential.
